Prepare your Raspberry Pi and breadboard
Insert the Temperature Sensor into the breadboard with the open side facing you, as shown
Insert the Resistor into the breadboard with one pin in the first column, and one pin in the second column
Take the Blue wire and insert the pin end into the first column of the breadboard below the resistor, and the socket end into the Raspberry Pi on the first pin from the left on the top row of pins

Take the Orange wire and insert the pin end into the second column of the breadboard below the resistor, and the socket end into the Raspberry Pi on the fourth pin from the left on the top row of pins
Take the Brown wire and insert the pin end into the fourth column of the breadboard, and the socket end into the Raspberry Pi on the third pin from the left on the top row of pins
Prepare your Light Sensor by finding the connector with four wires and plugging it into either side of the sensor. There should be a white wire, green wire, black wire and red wire
Plug the White wire into the Raspberry Pi on the fifth pin from the left on the bottom row of pins
Plug the Green wire into the Raspberry Pi on the first pin from the left on the bottom row of pins
Plug the Black wire into the Raspberry Pi on the second pin from the left on the bottom row of pins
Plug the Red wire into the Raspberry Pi on the third pin from the left on the bottom row of pins
Prepare the moisture sensor and comparator board
Connect the Black wire from the pronged sensor to the board
Connect the White wire from the pronged sensor to the board
Holding the comparator as shown, plug one end of the Yellow wire to the top pin on the comparator, and the other end into the Raspberry Pi on the ninth pin from the left on the bottom row
Take the Grey wire and connect one end to the second top pin on the comparator, and the other end into the Raspberry Pi on the tenth pin from the left on the top row
Take the Purple wire and connect one end to the third top pin on the comparator, and the other end into the Raspberry Pi on the tenth pin from the left on the bottom row
